TutorialScript.TutorialStep: It's Tuesday morning, and Edward's got a conundrum.
(At first he thought he just had a problem, but then found 'conundrum' in an online thesaurus and liked that much better. Although he still can't remember how to spell it.)
Edward's canondrum is this: he's not sure who he is any more.
I mean, back in the day he was one of the popular kids. He even used to date Monica. Maybe this goth thing has just been a phase.
Although his fellow classmates would be shagrinned to know this. After all, he and his girlfriend Mave DEFINE goth for most of the school. Could he give that up?
The endless war with the emos like Phoebe is getting old, too. Maybe they aren't so different after all. Is it time to bury the hatchet...

...or to sharpen it? Because the part of Edward that hated being popular has always wanted to bring his old crowd down. Could there be a goth revolution? Could the old order be overthrown and a new power rise?
To do that, Edward's going to need a lot of friends... or a lot of people who think he's cool. Is it possible in just four days?!
Whatever happens, it will indoobitabilly be a most exitudinal week for Edward. Definitely no time to review that feedback from the English teacher.
